alert.note: Alert for Beaufort; Charleston; Colleton; Dorchester (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 23 at 4:46PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Beaufort, Charleston, Colleton, Dorchester, Hampton and Jasper. * WHEN...Until 715 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 444 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated a line of slow moving thunderstorms with torrential rainfall extending from Lobeco, Knowles and Coosawhatchie northeast to southern Dorchester County. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 4 inches of rain have fallen in some areas so far today, the highest falling int portions of Beaufort County near Laurel Bay. Be alert for flooding along parts of Highway 17. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Beaufort, Ridgeland, Yemassee, Clarendon, Hollywood, Ravenel, Meggett, Green Pond, Ashepoo, White Hall, Ritter, Dale, Hendersonville, Jacksonboro, Gardens Corner, Sheldon, Beaufort Marine Corps Air Station, Pocotaligo, Adams Run and Laurel Bay.
